title: Is playing "walking simulator" punishable?
body: In recentish times when people want to spite their team or one particular person they don't afk or run it down mid anymore, instead I've seen a rise in those individuals taking tours of the jungle until the game is over. They may farm occasionally, but mostly they just take a stroll and smell the daisies. Does riot have any advice on how to deal with this? How should we categorize this in reports if it is punishable? It's basically afk because the farm they do get will never contribute to their team's victory, however they are technically moving around the map. They may die to enemies that are travelling through the area, but that's not the same as intentional feeding.

replies.body:
The system will eventually learn to catch it, and massively underperforming repeatedly is already easy to detect.

The issue is that it is very hard for a computer to determine if it is a bad game or intentional unless there is a constant pattern, and the massive number of false/brat-rage reports means riot cant even begin to review them all manually.

Incidentally, the fact people are doing this shows that they _are_ getting banned for just quitting or inting.
